feats.name: Baby
feats.description: Your anchor is Baby, a Laser Wolf from Castrovel. His presence helps ground you in this reality. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to both Perception checks and Will saves against illusions and holograms. When you come within 10 feet of an illusion or hologram that can be disbelieved, the GM rolls a secret check for you to disbelieve it, even if you didn't spend an action to Interact with the illusion or hologram.

actions.name: Touch Something Real
actions.description: Briefly touching or fidgeting with your anchor helps you evaluate your situation clearly. Once per round, decrease the value of your Frightened or Stupefied condition by 1. If you have none of these conditions, you instead gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Will saves against fear effects until the start of your next turn.

feats.name: Debris Zone
feats.description: You pull in debris, floods of water, or other random objects from the multiverse; your quantum field becomes difficult terrain.

actions.name: Debris Zone
actions.description: You pull in debris, floods of water, or other random objects from the multiverse; your quantum field becomes difficult terrain.

feats.name: Radiant Zone
feats.description: The reality you conjure is much brighter than your own. The area of your quantum field becomes bright light. Creatures in your quantum field must attempt a Fortitude save against your class DC; creatures with light blindness treat their result as one step worse.

actions.name: Radiant Zone
actions.description: The reality you conjure is much brighter than your own. The area of your quantum field becomes bright light. Creatures in your quantum field must attempt a Fortitude save against your class DC; creatures with light blindness treat their result as one step worse.

degrees.Success: The creature is dazzled for 1 round.
degrees.Failure: The creature is blinded for 1 round and dazzled for 1 minute. The creature can spend an interact action rubbing its eyes to end this blinded condition.
degrees.Critical Failure: As failure, but the creature cannot rub the blindness from their eyes.

feats.name: Phreaker
feats.description: You've learned how to hack using traditional methods that are more convenient but often less secure, such as calling a data center's automatic help line and entering a unique tone to access a connected server. You can use Computers to Disable a Device or Hack a system using any computer, comm unit, or terminal instead of a hacking toolkit. If you're an expert in Computers and the equipment you use is at least 3rd level, you gain a +1 item bonus to Disable a Device or Hack.

feats.name: Imaginary Trick
feats.description: As a purveyor of the obscure and esoteric, you have gleaned a basic talent for illusions. You can cast Figment as an Occult Innate spell.

feats.name: Pinpoint Out
feats.description: You have learned to communicate with indiscriminate detail to allies. You immediately Point Out the creature and your allies get a +2 circumstance bonus to their perception checks to find it so long as they can see and understand you.

freeActions.name: Pinpoint Out
freeActions.description: You have learned to communicate with indiscriminate detail to allies. You immediately Point Out the creature and your allies get a +2 circumstance bonus to their perception checks to find it so long as they can see and understand you.

feats.name: Rogue Dedication
feats.description: You gain a skill feat and the rogue’s surprise attack class feature. You become trained in light armor. In addition, you become trained in Stealth or Thievery plus one skill of your choice; if you are already trained in both Stealth and Thievery, you become trained in an additional skill of your choice.

feats.name: Surprise Attack
feats.description: You spring into combat faster than foes can react. On the first round of combat, if you roll Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are off-guard to you.

feats.name: Sneak Attacker
feats.description: When your enemy can't properly defend itself, you take advantage to deal extra damage. If you Strike a creature that has the off-guard condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, a ranged weapon attack, or a ranged unarmed attack, you deal an extra 1d4 precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown melee weapon, that weapon must also be agile or finesse.

inventory.name: Tempweave
inventory.description: Tempweave suits are reinforced hooded garments woven with thermal fabric and venting wires, popularly worn for trips to Castrovel's jungles and other humid climates.

inventory.name: Zero Knife
inventory.description: Unfolding like a switchblade, a supercooled chamber within this weapon's grip instantly forms a blade of ice with an aura of intense cold.

inventory.name: Laser Pistol
inventory.description: This compact energy pistol is the most popular sidearm in the Pact Worlds thanks to its reliability, durability, and affordability. Most common laser pistols have a heat-treated, lightweight polycarbon body ending in a long, slim barrel.

inventory.name: Tactical Silenced Scoped Seeker Rifle
inventory.description: This single-shot sniper rifle is one of the most popular weapons in the Vast thanks to its stability and reliability with minimal upkeep. It has a metallic cylinder filled with internal sound baffles to reduce the noise of shots fired, but your targets may still cry out in pain.

actions.name: Adjust Sight
actions.description: Increase the range increment of the Seeker Rifle by 10 feet; this lasts until the beginning of your next turn or until you're no longer wielding the weapon, whichever comes first.

inventory.name: Jump Jets
inventory.description: Powerful boosters attached to your armor allow you to fly short distances.

actions.name: Activate Jets
actions.description: You activate your jump jets to get a quick boost. You Fly up to 20 feet with a maximum height of 10 feet, or you fly up to 20 feet straight up. You must land at the end of this movement or fall. The jets can't lift you if you're Encumbered.

inventory.name: Datajack
inventory.description: This cybernetic is a programmable data port that integrates into your body, allowing you to access computers and digital storage devices. Any handheld computer can be inserted directly into the port, while larger systems typically require an adapter cable. You don't need an interface to acccess the system, as it connects directly to your nervous system via the datajack. You must still attempt any skill checks associated with operating the device, such as Computers to access a system. Some closed systems don't allow direct data access at all.

inventory.name: Invisibility Spell Gem
inventory.description: This latticed gemstone is suspended in a silicon casing and encoded with the magical script necessary to cast Invisibility.

gem.name: Invisibility
gem.description: Illusions bend light around the target, rendering it invisible. This makes it undetected to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it hidden to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

inventory.name: Overheat Spell Gem
inventory.description: This latticed gemstone is suspended in a silicon casing and encoded with the magical script necessary to cast Overheat.

gem.name: Overheat
gem.description: You collect heat generated by nearby bodies and technological devices and vent it toward a nearby target. You deal 2d6 fire damage to the target. On a failed save, the target's held equipment becomes hot to the touch for the next round. Unless the target drops its currently held equipment at the start of its turn, it takes 1d4 fire damage.

inventory.name: Cellular Stimulant Spell Gem
inventory.description: This latticed gemstone is suspended in a silicon casing and encoded with the magical script necessary to cast Cellular Stimulant.

gem.name: Cellular Stimulant
gem.targets: 1 living creature that is not fatigued or quickened
gem.description: You vitalize and stimulate the target at a cellular level, giving it a temporary burst of energy that unfortunately takes an exhausting toll. The target attempts a Fortitude save (it may choose to fail). If the target fails, it gains the Quickened condition and can use the extra action to Stride or Strike. After that round ends, the target becomes fatigued until it can rest for 10 minutes.

warpSpells.name: Warp Probability
warpSpells.trigger: You fail an attack roll or saving throw
warpSpells.description: You open your mind to read the underlying probability of the multiverse. Reroll the failed check and take the better result.

warpSpells.name: Friendly Push
warpSpells.description: You exert magical force to propel a willing creature up to 10 feet in a straight line, including upward, though if they aren't on solid ground or have another way to maintain their height (such as a Fly speed) when the movement ends, they fall. When you Sustain the spell, you can move them again or choose a new target within range and move them instead. You can cast this spell on an unconscious ally, and if you do, the movement from this spell doesn't trigger reactions.

spells.name: Analyze Target
spells.description: You focus on the target, gathering data as magical holograms display information. When the casting is complete, you learn biometric information about the target, including its fingerprints, medical conditions, and other basic physiological information. You or anyone you advice about the analysis gains a +1 circumstance bonus to Impersonate the creature, on Medicine checks to Treat Wounds, and to Recall Knowledge actions about the creature. If the creature is illusory or under the effects of illusion magic, you detect this only if the effect's rank is lower than the spell rank of your Analyze Target spell.

heightened.3rd: The circumstance bonus increases to +2 and you can target up to 10 creatures.
heightened.6th: The circumstance bonus increases to +3 and you can target any number of creatures.

spells.name: Adhere
spells.description: You create a molecular bond between an object you touch and another object or surface that object is touching. Pulling the object free of that surface requires a successful Athletics check against your spell DC to Force Open. If you instead touch one unoccupied 5-foot square, that surface becomes charged with adhering magic. That space becomes Greater Difficult Terrain.

spells.name: Figment
spells.description: You create a simple illusory sound or vision. A sound adds the auditory trait to the spell and the sound can't include intelligible words or elaborate music. A vision adds the visual trait, can be no larger than a 5-foot cube, and is clearly crude and undetailed if viewed from within 15 feet. When you Cast or Sustain the Spell, you can attempt to Create a Diversion with the illusion, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to your Deception check. If the attempt fails against a creature, that creature disbelieves the figment.

spells.name: Injury Echo
spells.description: You manifest an injury from the future or past to harm a creature in the present. Choose bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage. The target takes 1d6 of the selected damage type with a basic Will save. If the target fails its save and then takes the same type of damage before the end of your next turn, it takes an additional 1d4 persistent bleed damage.

heightened.+2: The initial damage increases by 1d6, and the persistent damage on a failure increases by 1d4.

spells.name: Internal Distortion
spells.description: You create a spatial ripple inside of a creature’s body, injuring it from within. The target takes 1d6 slashing damage, with a basic Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the target is also sickened 1.

spells.name: Stumble
spells.description: A burst of microgravity causes a tremor around the target, pulling it toward the ground. The target attempts a Reflex save.

degrees.Failure: The target becomes off-guard for 1 round. If the target was flying, swimming, or floating, it falls 10 feet downward.
degrees.Critical Failure: The target falls prone. If the target was flying, swimming, or floating, it falls 20 feet downward.

heightened.+1: If the target is flying, it falls an additional 10 feet on a failure and 20 feet on a critical failure.

spells.name: Kinetic Ram
spells.description: Gathering kinetic energy, you either focus it in a straight line or disperse it as an encircling ripple. Any creature targeted by this spell must succeed at a Fortitude saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from you (or 20 feet on a critical failure). If you spend one action on the spell, it targets one creature with 15 feet; two actions targets one creature within 30 feet, doubles the distance it is pushed on a failure, and on a critical failure it knocks them prone and deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage; three actions targets all creatures in a 5-foot emanation.

spells.name: Wisp Ally
spells.description: You summon a Tiny bouncing wisp of light that easily distracts even the most determined of combatants. A wisp doesn't take up space, grant flanking, or have any other attributes a creature would. The wisp generate bright light in a 10-foot radius. When you Cast the Spell and each time you Sustain, you can direct the wisp to move to a creature you choose within range and attempt to distract the target. Each creature who fails a Will save against a distracting wisp become off-guard until the end of their next turn. If the creature fails a Will save against a second wisp in the same round, it becomes Dazzled until the end of its next turn instead.

heightened.+1: You create one additional wisp when you Cast the Spell. When you Sustain this spell, you can move all wisps you've created.

spells.name: Befuddle
spells.description: You sow seeds of confusion in your target’s mind, causing its actions and thoughts to become clumsy.

degrees.Success: The target is Clumsy 1 and Stupefied 1.
degrees.Failure: The target is Clumsy 2 and Stupefied 2.
degrees.Critical Failure: The target is Clumsy 3, Stupefied 3, and Confused.

spells.name: Time Skip
spells.description: You grasp on to a creature’s place in the timestream, pulling them a moment into the future. Temporal friction grinds against their body as the timestream rights itself, and they might be disoriented from the displacement. The target takes 3d6 force damage with a basic Fortitude save. On a critical failure, they are also slowed 1.

spells.name: Agonizing Relocation
spells.description: You create a connection between a creature’s body and an unoccupied space within 10 feet of it. The target’s body is partially displaced toward that space, causing significant pain throughout their entire body. The target must attempt a Fortitude save. If the target fails or critically fails its save, it can choose not to be relocated, at the cost of taking double damage from the spell.

degrees.Failure: The creature takes 4d6 slashing damage and is moved to the linked space.
degrees.Critical Failure: The target takes 6d6 slashing damage and is moved to the linked space. Unlike most forced movement, a critical failure against agonizing relocation can move its target into a dangerous location.

spells.name: Warping Pull
spells.trigger: An effect would deal damage to an ally within range
spells.targets: 1 willing creature that would take damage from the triggering effect
spells.description: You get an ally out of danger with a teleporting pull. You teleport the target to an unoccupied square up to 10 feet closer to you. The target gains resistance 5 to all damage against the triggering effect.

spells.name: Temporal Bullets
spells.trigger: You miss, but don't critically miss, with a ranged weapon attack
spells.description: You rewind time and adjust probability to ensure an attack that just missed still does damage to its intended target. Roll damage as though you hit the target with the Strike, but the target only takes half the damage. You are then immune to temporal bullets for 10 minutes.

degrees.Failure: The target is Glitching 1 and Stunned 1.
degrees.Critical Failure: The target is Glitching 2 and Stunned 2.

spells.name: Verdant Code
spells.description: You cause flowering vines or other plant matter to grow from a computer or unattended other device. Plant matter eplodes from the target device, filling all squares within a 20-foot radius. Each round a creature starts its turn in the area, it takes 2d6 piercing damage and must attempt a Reflex save. The growth also covers the device, requiring a successful DC 5 flat check for non-remote access for the spell's duration.

degrees.Critical Failure: The creature takes full damage and is immobilized for 1 round.

actions.name: Warp Reality
actions.description: Your quantum field activates and lasts as long as you Sustain it (up to 10 minutes) or until the end of your next turn. Your quantum field is a 15-foot-radius burst centered on a point you choose within 100 feet. While your Quantum Field is active, you can use actions that have the anchoring trait. As an Analyst, you see and understand infinite possibilities and complex theoretical equations as clearly as though they were etched into your surroundings. When you Seek or Recall Knowledge, you can apply the result against two related creatures, hazards, unattended objects, and effects in your quantum field. Whenever you sustain your quantum field, you can seek or Recall Knowledge against an appropriate target in your quantum field as a free action. Your quantum field automatically deactivates if you're knocked out, you dismiss it, or if you move more than 100 feet away from it.

actions.name: Isolated Spell Matrix
actions.description: If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell that has a range, increase the spell's range to 100 feet. The spell can only affect targets inside of your quantum field.
